wikipedia_page.main: Vice Admiral Thomas Fraser (1796–1870) was a Royal Navy officer serving in the mid 19th century. He was an important contributor to British victories in the First Anglo-Burmese War.

response: *Rear Admiral Thomas Fraser (1796–1870), hero of the First Anglo-Burmese War
*Vice Admiral Thomas Fraser (1796–1870) son of the above

* Thomas Fraser (1796–1870) also joined the Royal Navy and rose to become a vice-admiral. He died at 19 Brighton Place in Portobello, Edinburgh. He is buried close to his father.Edinburgh Post Office Directory (Portobello) 1869
